translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter about Perfumes and Water
The Elder Dhammasavani’s Birth Story
“The Victor called Padumuttara,
who had gone to the end of all things,
expounding the Four Truths,
was refreshing many people.
At that time I was🔽a matted-hair ascetic with psychic powers;
shaking my bark-cloth garments,
I was going through the sky.
Above the best Buddha
I was unable to go;
like a bird hitting a rock,
I was unable to go on.
This had never happened to me before,
disturbing my movement;
just as if I had risen up from the water,
so I went through the sky.
“A man of great power

analyzed: heṭṭhā āsīnaḥ bhavissati  handa mā enam gavesissa
translated: was sitting below;🔽‘Well, I will search for him,’
I thought, ‘perhaps I will find something.’
Descending from the sky,
I heard the Teacher’s voice;
expounding impermanence,
I received it then.
Having received the perception of impermanence,
I went to my own home;
having lived there for the rest of my life,
I died there.
In my last life,
I remember that hearing of the Dhamma,
By that deed well done,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
For twenty-one thousand eons,
I delighted in the deva world;

analyzed: ekapaññāsa khattum ca  deva rajjam akārayi  ekasattatikkhattum ca
translated: Fifty-one times I was a king of the devas,
And seventy-one times a wheel-turning monarch.
I had extensive dominion over a region,
Incalculable by count.
While sitting in my father’s house,
The monk with developed faculties,
Illuminating with a verse,
Spoke of impermanence.
I remember that perception,
Wandering through the cycle of existence;
I have not yet penetrated the end,
Nibbāna, the deathless state.

analyzed: aniccā vata saṅkhārā  uppāda vaya dhammino
translated: Inconstant, alas, are compounded things;🔽They are by nature to arise and pass away.
Having arisen, they cease;
Their stilling is blissful.
Having heard the verse together,
I remembered my past deeds;
While sitting on the same seat,
I attained perfection.
At the age of seven years,🔽I attained perfection.
The Buddha, the one with vision,
ordained me, knowing my abilities.
Though I was like a child,
I completed what had to be done;
What have I to do today,
in the Dispensation of the Son of the Sakyans?
For a hundred thousand eons,
the deed I did then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
the fruit of hearing the True Dhamma.
The four analytical insights,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Dhammasavani recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhammasavaniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Dhammasavaniyattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dhammasavaniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽dhammasavaniya therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Dhammasavani’s Story is finished.
